required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Effect of Tocilizumab Plus Methotrexate on Safety and Signs and Symptoms in Patients With Moderate to Severe Active Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-arm, Open-label Study of the Safety and Reduction of Signs and Symptoms During Treatment With Tocilizumab in Combination With Methotrexate, in Patients With Moderate to Severe Active Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This single arm, open-label study will assess the safety and efficacy with regar d to reduction of signs and symptoms of treatment with tocilizumab in combinatio n with methotrexate, in patients with moderate to severe active rheumatoid arthr itis. Patients will receive tocilizumab 8mg/kg iv, every 4 weeks and methotrexat e 10-25mg weekly. The anticipated time on study treatment is 3-12 months, and th e target sample size is <500 individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 50 Response at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: ACR50 is defined as 50 percent (%) improvement in: a) Swollen Joints Count (SJC) and Tender Joints Count (TJC) and b) Three of the following 5 assessments: Participant's global assessment of pain by Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Participant's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Investigator/Physician's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Participant's assessment of disability measured by the Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI) Acute phase reactant levels - Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate or C-Reactive Protein (ESR or CRP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With ACR20 and ACR70 Response at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: ACR20 and ACR70 are defined as 20 and 70 percent improvement respectively in: a) SJC and TJC and b) Three of the following 5 assessments: Participant's global assessment of pain by VAS Participant's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Investigator/Physician's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Participant's assessment of disability measured by HAQ-DI Acute phase reactant (ESR or CRP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Onset of ACR20, ACR50, and ACR70
secondary_outcome.description: ACR20, ACR50 and ACR70 are defined as 20, 50 and 70 percent improvement respectively in: a) SJC and TJC and b) Three of the following 5 assessments: Participant's global assessment of pain by VAS Participant's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Investigator/Physician's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Participant's assessment of disability measured by HAQ-DI Acute phase reactant (ESR or CRP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin at Week 24
SJC and TJC at Baseline and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The number of swollen joints (66 joint count) were scored as swollen=1 and not swollen=0, and the number of tender joints (68 joint count ) were scored as tender=1 and not tender=0, and counted. Scores ranged from 0 to 66 for swollen joint counts and from 0 to 68 for tender joint counts. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (a reduction in the number of swollen or tender joints).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in SJC and TJC at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The number of swollen joints (66 joint count) were scored as swollen=1 and not swollen=0, and the number of tender joints (68 joint count ) were scored as tender=1 and not tender=0, and counted. Scores ranged from 0 to 66 for swollen joint counts and from 0 to 68 for tender joint counts. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (a reduction in the number of swollen or tender joints).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain as Assessed by the Participant at Baseline and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The participants assessed their pain using a 0 to 100 millimeter (mm) VAS. The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 mm, and is described as "no pain" and the right-hand extreme equals 100 mm as "unbearable pain". The participants marked the line corresponding to the level of their pain and the distance from the left edge was measured. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Pain as Assessed by the Participant at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The participants assessed their pain using a 0 to 100 millimeter (mm) VAS. The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 mm, and is described as "no pain" and the right-hand extreme equals 100 mm as "unbearable pain". The participants marked the line corresponding to the level of their pain and the distance from the left edge was measured. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant's Global Assessment of Disease Activity at Baseline and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The participant's global assessment of disease activity is assessed on a 0 to 100 mm horizontal VAS by the participant. The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 mm, and is described as "no disease activity" (symptom-free and no arthritis symptoms) and the right-hand extreme equals 100 mm, as "maximum disease activity" (maximum arthritis disease activity). A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of disease activity).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Participant's Global Assessment of Disease Activity at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The participant's global assessment of disease activity is assessed on a 0 to 100 mm horizontal VAS by the participant. The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 mm, and is described as "no disease activity" (symptom-free and no arthritis symptoms) and the right-hand extreme equals 100 mm, as "maximum disease activity" (maximum arthritis disease activity). A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of disease activity).

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity at Baseline and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The physician's global assessment of disease activity is assessed on a 0 to 100 mm VAS by the physician. The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 mm, and is described as "no disease activity" (symptom-free and no arthritis symptoms) and the right-hand extreme equals 100 mm as "maximum disease activity" (maximum arthritis disease activity). The physicians marked the line corresponding to their assessment and the distance from the left edge was measured. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of disease activity).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The physician's global assessment of disease activity is assessed on a 0 to 100 mm VAS by the physician. The left-hand extreme of the line equals 0 mm, and is described as "no disease activity" (symptom-free and no arthritis symptoms) and the right-hand extreme equals 100 mm as "maximum disease activity" (maximum arthritis disease activity). The physicians marked the line corresponding to their assessment and the distance from the left edge was measured. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of disease activity).

secondary_outcome.measure: HAQ-DI at Baseline and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: HAQ-DI includes 20 questions concerning participant's activities of daily life, grouped in 8 scales of 2 to 3 questions for each activity. To respond to each question, a four-level response (score of 0 to 3 points), with higher scores showing larger functional limitations, was chosen. Scoring was as follows with respect to performance of participant's everyday activities: 0 =without difficulties; 1= with some difficulties; 2=with great difficulties; and 3= unable to perform these actions at all. Minimum score was 0, maximum score was 3. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of impairment).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in HAQ-DI at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: HAQ-DI includes 20 questions concerning participant's activities of daily life, grouped in 8 scales of 2 to 3 questions for each activity. To respond to each question, a four-level response (score of 0 to 3 points), with higher scores showing larger functional limitations, was chosen. Scoring was as follows with respect to performance of participant's everyday activities: 0=without difficulties; 1=with some difficulties; 2=with great difficulties; and 3=unable to perform these actions at all. Minimum score was 0, maximum score was 3. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of impairment).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under The Curve (AUC) of the ACR(n)
secondary_outcome.description: ACR-n was defined as the lowest of 3 values (the percent change in the swollen joint count, the percent change in the tender joint count, and the median of the other 5 measures in the ACR core data set which included Participant's global assessment of pain (VAS), Participant's global assessment of disease activity (VAS), Investigator/Physician's global assessment of disease activity (VAS), Participant's assessment of disability measured by the HAQ-DI Acute phase reactant levels - ESR or CRP). Therefore, a percentage value was assigned to each participant at each timepoint. AUC was calculated for each participant from baseline to Week 112. Mean and standard deviation values are are provided in percent*years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving ACR20 Response
secondary_outcome.description: ACR20 is defined as 20% improvement in: a) SJC and TJC and b) Three of the following 5 assessments: Participant's global assessment of pain (VAS) Participant's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Investigator/Physician's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Participant's assessment of disability measured by the HAQ-DI Acute phase reactant levels - ESR or CRP

secondary_outcome.measure: Odds Estimates for ACR Positive Response in Generalized Estimating Equation (GEE) Models
secondary_outcome.description: The probability of ACR positive response was determined using the GEE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Disease Activity Score Based on 28 Joint Count (DAS28) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from the number of SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the ESR (mm/hour) and participant's global assessment of disease activity (participant rated arthritis activity assessment with transformed scores ranging 0 to 10; higher scores indicated greater affectation due to disease activity). DAS28 (less than or equal to ) ≤3.2 = low disease activity, DAS28 (greater than) >3.2 to 5.1 = moderate to high disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Response by Categorical DAS28 Responses According to The European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR Response) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28- based EULAR response criteria were used to measure individual response as none, good, and moderate, depending on the extent of change from baseline and the level of disease activity reached. Good response: change from baseline >1.2 with DAS28 < 3.2; moderate response: change from baseline >1.2 with DAS28 >3.2 to <5.1 or change from baseline >0.6 to <1.2 with DAS28 <5.1; No response: change from baseline < 0.6 or change from baseline >0.6 and <1.2 with DAS28 >5.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of DAS28
secondary_outcome.description: The AUC was computed using the trapezoidal rule, considering baseline value as 0, through NCSS software. For each participant, AUC for DAS28 units was calculated. Each individual AUC DAS28 value was divided by 52 to have the conversion of AUC DAS28 in unit weeks to AUC DAS28 in unit years, as 1 week is approximately 1/52 years. The set of individual AUC DAS28 was computed as summary statistics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fatigue as Assessed Using the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT-Fatigue) Score at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT-F is a 13-item questionnaire. Participants scored each item on a 5-point scale: 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very much). The larger the participant's response to the questions (with the exception of 2 negatively stated), the greater the participant's fatigue. The sum of all responses resulted in the FACIT-Fatigue score for a total possible score of 0 (worse score) to 52 (better score). A higher score reflects an improvement in the participant's health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Remission (DAS28 Less Than [<] 2.6) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from the SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the ESR (mm/hour) and participant's global assessment of disease activity (participant rated arthritis activity assessment with transformed scores ranging 0 to 10; higher scores indicated greater affectation due to disease activity). DAS28 (less than or equal to ) ≤3.2 = low disease activity, DAS28 (greater than) >3.2 to 5.1 = moderate to high disease activity and DAS28<2.6 = remission

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QoL) Assessed by Short-Form 36 (SF-36) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well-being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, and mental health. Total of 3 variables were analyzed (2 composite subscales and vitality score). The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Rheumatoid Factor (RF) at Week 24 in Participants With Positive RF

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously (iv), once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throuhgout the study.

baseline.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug and who had at least one effectiveness measurement performed after baseline.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

Scoring was as follows with respect to performance of participant's everyday activities: 0 =without difficulties; 1= with some difficulties; 2=with great difficulties; and 3= unable to perform these actions at all. Minimum score was 0, maximum score was 3. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of impairment).
outcome.population: ITT Population. All participants with endpoint values collected at the specified timepoints were included in the analysis. n=number of participants analyzed for the given parameter at the specified time point.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: HAQ-DI at Baseline and Week 24
measure.description: HAQ-DI includes 20 questions concerning participant's activities of daily life, grouped in 8 scales of 2 to 3 questions for each activity. To respond to each question, a four-level response (score of 0 to 3 points), with higher scores showing larger functional limitations, was chosen. Scoring was as follows with respect to performance of participant's everyday activities: 0 =without difficulties; 1= with some difficulties; 2=with great difficulties; and 3= unable to perform these actions at all. Minimum score was 0, maximum score was 3. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of impairment).
measure.population: ITT Population. All participants with endpoint values collected at the specified timepoints were included in the analysis. n=number of participants analyzed for the given parameter at the specified time point.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in HAQ-DI at Week 24
outcome.description: HAQ-DI includes 20 questions concerning participant's activities of daily life, grouped in 8 scales of 2 to 3 questions for each activity. To respond to each question, a four-level response (score of 0 to 3 points), with higher scores showing larger functional limitations, was chosen. Scoring was as follows with respect to performance of participant's everyday activities: 0=without difficulties; 1=with some difficulties; 2=with great difficulties; and 3=unable to perform these actions at all. Minimum score was 0, maximum score was 3. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of impairment).
outcome.population: ITT Population. All participants with endpoint values collected at both baseline and Week 24 were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in HAQ-DI at Week 24
measure.description: HAQ-DI includes 20 questions concerning participant's activities of daily life, grouped in 8 scales of 2 to 3 questions for each activity. To respond to each question, a four-level response (score of 0 to 3 points), with higher scores showing larger functional limitations, was chosen. Scoring was as follows with respect to performance of participant's everyday activities: 0=without difficulties; 1=with some difficulties; 2=with great difficulties; and 3=unable to perform these actions at all. Minimum score was 0, maximum score was 3. A positive change from baseline represents an improvement (reduced level of impairment).
measure.population: ITT Population. All participants with endpoint values collected at both baseline and Week 24 were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Area Under The Curve (AUC) of the ACR(n)
outcome.description: ACR-n was defined as the lowest of 3 values (the percent change in the swollen joint count, the percent change in the tender joint count, and the median of the other 5 measures in the ACR core data set which included Participant's global assessment of pain (VAS), Participant's global assessment of disease activity (VAS), Investigator/Physician's global assessment of disease activity (VAS), Participant's assessment of disability measured by the HAQ-DI Acute phase reactant levels - ESR or CRP). Therefore, a percentage value was assigned to each participant at each timepoint. AUC was calculated for each participant from baseline to Week 112. Mean and standard deviation values are are provided in percent*years.
outcome.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: Area Under The Curve (AUC) of the ACR(n)
measure.description: ACR-n was defined as the lowest of 3 values (the percent change in the swollen joint count, the percent change in the tender joint count, and the median of the other 5 measures in the ACR core data set which included Participant's global assessment of pain (VAS), Participant's global assessment of disease activity (VAS), Investigator/Physician's global assessment of disease activity (VAS), Participant's assessment of disability measured by the HAQ-DI Acute phase reactant levels - ESR or CRP). Therefore, a percentage value was assigned to each participant at each timepoint. AUC was calculated for each participant from baseline to Week 112. Mean and standard deviation values are are provided in percent*years.
measure.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving ACR20 Response
outcome.description: ACR20 is defined as 20% improvement in: a) SJC and TJC and b) Three of the following 5 assessments: Participant's global assessment of pain (VAS) Participant's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Investigator/Physician's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Participant's assessment of disability measured by the HAQ-DI Acute phase reactant levels - ESR or CRP
outcome.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 2 were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving ACR20 Response
measure.description: ACR20 is defined as 20% improvement in: a) SJC and TJC and b) Three of the following 5 assessments: Participant's global assessment of pain (VAS) Participant's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Investigator/Physician's global assessment of disease activity (VAS) Participant's assessment of disability measured by the HAQ-DI Acute phase reactant levels - ESR or CRP
measure.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 2 were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Odds Estimates for ACR Positive Response in Generalized Estimating Equation (GEE) Models
outcome.description: The probability of ACR positive response was determined using the GEE.
outcome.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: Odds Estimates for ACR Positive Response in Generalized Estimating Equation (GEE) Models
measure.description: The probability of ACR positive response was determined using the GEE.
measure.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Disease Activity Score Based on 28 Joint Count (DAS28) at Week 24
outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from the number of SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the ESR (mm/hour) and participant's global assessment of disease activity (participant rated arthritis activity assessment with transformed scores ranging 0 to 10; higher scores indicated greater affectation due to disease activity). DAS28 (less than or equal to ) ≤3.2 = low disease activity, DAS28 (greater than) >3.2 to 5.1 = moderate to high disease activity.
outcome.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at both baseline and Week 24 were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Disease Activity Score Based on 28 Joint Count (DAS28) at Week 24
measure.description: DAS28 calculated from the number of SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the ESR (mm/hour) and participant's global assessment of disease activity (participant rated arthritis activity assessment with transformed scores ranging 0 to 10; higher scores indicated greater affectation due to disease activity). DAS28 (less than or equal to ) ≤3.2 = low disease activity, DAS28 (greater than) >3.2 to 5.1 = moderate to high disease activity.
measure.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at both baseline and Week 24 were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Response by Categorical DAS28 Responses According to The European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR Response) at Week 24
outcome.description: DAS28- based EULAR response criteria were used to measure individual response as none, good, and moderate, depending on the extent of change from baseline and the level of disease activity reached. Good response: change from baseline >1.2 with DAS28 < 3.2; moderate response: change from baseline >1.2 with DAS28 >3.2 to <5.1 or change from baseline >0.6 to <1.2 with DAS28 <5.1; No response: change from baseline < 0.6 or change from baseline >0.6 and <1.2 with DAS28 >5.1.
outcome.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 24 were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Response by Categorical DAS28 Responses According to The European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR Response) at Week 24
measure.description: DAS28- based EULAR response criteria were used to measure individual response as none, good, and moderate, depending on the extent of change from baseline and the level of disease activity reached. Good response: change from baseline >1.2 with DAS28 < 3.2; moderate response: change from baseline >1.2 with DAS28 >3.2 to <5.1 or change from baseline >0.6 to <1.2 with DAS28 <5.1; No response: change from baseline < 0.6 or change from baseline >0.6 and <1.2 with DAS28 >5.1.
measure.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 24 were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: AUC of DAS28
outcome.description: The AUC was computed using the trapezoidal rule, considering baseline value as 0, through NCSS software. For each participant, AUC for DAS28 units was calculated. Each individual AUC DAS28 value was divided by 52 to have the conversion of AUC DAS28 in unit weeks to AUC DAS28 in unit years, as 1 week is approximately 1/52 years. The set of individual AUC DAS28 was computed as summary statistics.
outcome.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: AUC of DAS28
measure.description: The AUC was computed using the trapezoidal rule, considering baseline value as 0, through NCSS software. For each participant, AUC for DAS28 units was calculated. Each individual AUC DAS28 value was divided by 52 to have the conversion of AUC DAS28 in unit weeks to AUC DAS28 in unit years, as 1 week is approximately 1/52 years. The set of individual AUC DAS28 was computed as summary statistics.
measure.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Fatigue as Assessed Using the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT-Fatigue) Score at Week 24
outcome.description: FACIT-F is a 13-item questionnaire. Participants scored each item on a 5-point scale: 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very much). The larger the participant's response to the questions (with the exception of 2 negatively stated), the greater the participant's fatigue. The sum of all responses resulted in the FACIT-Fatigue score for a total possible score of 0 (worse score) to 52 (better score). A higher score reflects an improvement in the participant's health status.
outcome.population: ITT Population. All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 24 were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: Fatigue as Assessed Using the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT-Fatigue) Score at Week 24
measure.description: FACIT-F is a 13-item questionnaire. Participants scored each item on a 5-point scale: 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very much). The larger the participant's response to the questions (with the exception of 2 negatively stated), the greater the participant's fatigue. The sum of all responses resulted in the FACIT-Fatigue score for a total possible score of 0 (worse score) to 52 (better score). A higher score reflects an improvement in the participant's health status.
measure.population: ITT Population. All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 24 were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Remission (DAS28 Less Than [<] 2.6) at Week 24
outcome.description: DAS28 calculated from the SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the ESR (mm/hour) and participant's global assessment of disease activity (participant rated arthritis activity assessment with transformed scores ranging 0 to 10; higher scores indicated greater affectation due to disease activity). DAS28 (less than or equal to ) ≤3.2 = low disease activity, DAS28 (greater than) >3.2 to 5.1 = moderate to high disease activity and DAS28<2.6 = remission
outcome.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 24 were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Remission (DAS28 Less Than [<] 2.6) at Week 24
measure.description: DAS28 calculated from the SJC and TJC using the 28 joints count, the ESR (mm/hour) and participant's global assessment of disease activity (participant rated arthritis activity assessment with transformed scores ranging 0 to 10; higher scores indicated greater affectation due to disease activity). DAS28 (less than or equal to ) ≤3.2 = low disease activity, DAS28 (greater than) >3.2 to 5.1 = moderate to high disease activity and DAS28<2.6 = remission
measure.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 24 were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Quality of Life (QoL) Assessed by Short-Form 36 (SF-36) at Week 24
outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well-being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, and mental health. Total of 3 variables were analyzed (2 composite subscales and vitality score). The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).
outcome.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 24 were included in the analysis.

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

measure.title: Quality of Life (QoL) Assessed by Short-Form 36 (SF-36) at Week 24
measure.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well-being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, and mental health. Total of 3 variables were analyzed (2 composite subscales and vitality score). The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).
measure.population: ITT Population; All participants with endpoint values collected at Week 24 were included in the analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were recorded from the date of first dose of drug administration until the end of study

group.title: Tocilizumab
group.description: Participants received tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv, once every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions along with methotrexate 10-25 mg weekly, orally or parenterally. The dose of methotrexate should have remained stable throughout the study.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The study being conducted under this agreement is part of the overall study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the study, but after the first publication or presentation that involves the overall study. Sponsor may request that confidential information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
